properties.address: Port Appin Village Hall, Port Appin, Appin, PA38 4DE
properties.description: Drop-in for a blether, hot drink & cake. They will have lots of board games and cards available too No need to book just pop along. The Hub is FREE to attend & all are very welcome The Community Vehicle will be available to transport registered passengers to the Hub at no charge, please contact Isobel to find out more [email protected] Please contact Victoria Kynaston to find out more about the Health & Wellbeing Programme and the work of ACDT [email protected]/[email protected] Isle of Coll An Cridhe Community Centre have a warm space open from 9am to 9pm each day. There is tea and coffee and free internet available. Campbell Memorial Hall, Benderloch, PA37 1QP Organised by St Modan’s Church in collaboration with Bookends Benderloch. The hall is just behind the church and all are welcome. They provide a Soup and Bread lunch, tea and coffee, an opportunity to chat and to take away books to read. This is a Free Event. 2 Gibraltar Street, Oban, PA34 4AY Crossroads North Argyll will be providing a warm space for unpaid carers on Wednesdays from 11am – 1pm. They will be providing hot drinks, biscuits and a blether with other unpaid carers in a warm space. Live Argyll have launched their ‘Winter at the liveArgyll Libraries’ initiative, inviting people to use their libraries as warm spaces, and providing games, puzzles and as well as the use of library resources. You can find all information about this initiative here including opening times for the libraries taking part: Winter at the library - Live Argyll 2 Soroba Road, Oban, PA34 4HU Monday - 2pm-3.30pm Fellowship Café Tuesday - 2pm-3.30pm Craft cafe Tuesday - 5pm Evening Meal Wednesday - 2pm-3.30pm Stork Café Thursday - 10am-3pm Moving On at Green Shoots Thursday - 11am- 12pm Recovery Café Thursday - 2pm-4pm Wellbeing Café Friday - 12pm-3.30pm Music Group Friday - 14.30pm Quiz Friday - 5pm Evening Meal Muir Street, Boswell House, 14 Argyll Square, Oban, PA34 4BD Pop in for a breakfast roll and a chat! Dalriach Road, Oban, Argyll, PA34 5JE Rockfield Brae, Oban, Stevenson Street, Argyll PA34 5DQ The space is open to all, and offers affordable and nutritious food and drink with a ‘by donation' or ‘pay what you can' option. Community soup lunch Soroba Lane,Oban,PA34 4HX Pop in for a warm welcome and a hot cuppa, everyone is welcome.

hours._text: Tuesday mornings 14 January until 18 March 10am-12pm ; Thursdays 12-2.30pm ; Wednesdays from 11am – 1pm ; Monday - Friday 11am - 5pm ; Tuesdays 12-2pm ; The building is warm , there is plenty of space and everyone is very welcome. a programme of different events, activities and drop-in sessions throughout the winter. These will change each month with announcements made on the website page and via flyers that you can pick up in the Centre. Available for the duration of the project, they have made a custom Winter Warmer free membership. Just ask at Reception about the Winter Warmer membership and their team will tell you more.; Open every day, 10-4pm ; Wednesdays 12-2pm ; Warm Wednesdays 3.30-5pm

These will change each month with announcements made on the website page and via flyers that you can pick up in the Centre.
